page.title: 07Barclose Garage, Scaleby
page.content: What used to be Barclose Petrol Station is now an agricultural garage. They repair cars and carry out M.O.T. tests also. The garage is owned by the son of Mrs. Kate Little of Barclose. She has lived 45 years in her present house and 59 years in Scaleby. Before the garage existed, Mrs. Little's husband was the blacksmith. He shoed horses for the people of Scaleby. For 30 years Mrs. Little's father had no tractor on his farm but horses to do the work. Now there is a lot more machinery used on farms. Cars only gradually came to the village. There were 5 by 1926.
